qas.question: Who was the ruler of China in 677?
Who led the military expedition in Fujian?
What is the name of the son of Chen Zheng?
Who was the ruler of China in 885?
What was responsible for bringing the language of North middle China to the Fujian region?

answers.text: two waves of migrations from the north

qas.question: What country did Chen Yuanguang rule in 677?

plausible_answers.text: to pacify the rebellion in Fujian

qas.question: What did Chen Yuanguang and his son lead a military exedition for?
When did Wang Chao and his son lead an expedition to pacify the Huanf Chao rebellion?
What dialect did the migrations from the south help to develop?
Who led waves of migrations during the reign of Emperor Gaozong?

plausible_answers.text: the Middle Chinese phonology of northern China

qas.question: What did Wang Chao bring during the 7th century into Zhangzhou?

plausible_answers.text: led a military expedition force to pacify the Huang Chao rebellion

qas.question: What did Wang Shenzhi do in China in 677?
What is Wang Chao's sons name?
Who was the ruler of Xizong in 677?

context: In 677 (during the reign of <a0_0><b14_0>Emperor Gaozong<b14_0/><a0_0/>), <a1_0><b10_0>Chen Zheng<b10_0/><a1_0/> (陳政), together with his son <a2_0><b13_0>Chen Yuanguang<b13_0/><a2_0/> (陳元光), led a military expedition <b6_0>to pacify the rebellion in Fujian<b6_0/>. They settled in Zhangzhou and brought <b11_0>the Middle Chinese phonology of northern <b5_0>China<b11_0/><b5_0/> during the 7th century into Zhangzhou; In <b7_0>885<b7_0/>, (during the reign of <a3_0>Emperor Xizong of Tang<a3_0/>), the two brothers Wang Chao (王潮) and <b8_0>Wang Shenzhi<b8_0/> (王審知), <b12_0>led a military expedition force to pacify the Huang Chao rebellion<b12_0/>. They brought the Middle Chinese phonology commonly spoken in Northern China into Zhangzhou. These <a4_0>two waves of migrations from the north<a4_0/> generally brought the language of northern Middle Chinese into the Fujian region. This then gradually evolved into the <b9_0>Zhangzhou dialect<b9_0/>.
